data.title: U18 Team Pushes On At World Championship
data.meta_description: Team USA has Won Two Straight After Falling in Opener.
data.meta_site_name: USA Hockey National Team Development Program
data.text:
The U.S. National Under-18 Team continues play at the 2015 International Ice Hockey Federation Menâ€™s Under-18 World Championship this week. After losing the opener, Team USA won its next two games and finishes out round-robin play against Germany on Tuesday. The team currently sits second in Group A.

Crossover quarterfinal action begins on Thursday. The winner of each quarterfinal moves onto the semifinals on Saturday. The bronze-medal and gold-medal contests are set for Sunday.

TOURNAMENT ROUNDUP: The United States opened the tournament with a 3-1 setback to Russia on Thursday. Troy Terry (Highlands Ranch, Colo.) registered the lone goal while Luke Opilka (St. Louis, Mo.) finished with 13 stops.

The team came back on Friday to beat Slovakia 10-0. Auston Matthews (Scottsdale, Ariz.) and Jack Roslovic (Columbus, Ohio) each tallied two goals while Casey Fitzgerald (North Reading, Mass.), Matthew Tkachuk (St. Louis, Mo.), Luke Kunin (Chesterfield, Mo.), Brendan Warren (Carleton, Mich.), Jeremy Bracco (Freeport, N.Y.) and Terry had single tallies. Evan Sarthou (Black Diamond, Wash.) earned the shutout with 15 stops.
